pullRequest.title: Move Research System To Datapack
pullRequest.bodyText:
Closes #6178
Closes #5027
Closes ldtteam/minecolonies-features#195
Changes proposed in this pull request:

Moves all research from static assignment in ResearchInitializer to a json-based data pack.  Hardens inputs to handle most possible inconsistent behaviors from malformed user data packs, as well as moving forward past saves where the research names were spelled differently.
Moves any research effect-related constants possible out of coremod and into com.minecolonies.api.research.util's ResearchConstants.java.
Compresses the various ResearchEffect types into a single GlobalResearchEffect, of type double.  Adds functionality so that building upgrades can now be locked by research, if the research effect has levels defined.
Removes the individual blockhut-based research unlocks behaviors and compresses to AbstractBlockHut; if there's no research effect with the correct name, they'll be allowed, if there is and it isn't complete, they'll show the error tooltip and not be able to build.  Blockhut research can also now have levels, in which case, the hut can only be upgraded to the unlocked level.
Adds sounds for research-related successes and failures.
Removes research costs from server config file, as they're now handled in data packs.
Reworks the WindowUniversityHut and WindowResearchTree windows, adding tooltips, icons, and tightening up the UI.  Adds a cancel and reset button for in-progess and completed research respectively.
Cancelling completed research has a cost, and that cost is configurable through the config file.
Adds some debugging research-related settings to server config file, and logging to both dynamic and static loading of researches.
Adds serialization and deserialization to properly synch data packs from the server to clients in a dedicated server environment.  This message is only sent on initial connection, and when the server executes a data pack reload.

Research datapacks must be placed into the minecolonies/researches directory, and can consist of :

research-jsons, which require the "id":string (used as identifier and to autogenerate translation keys), "branch":, "requiredUniversityLevel":int, and may optionally have "subtitle":string,  "icon":string (which must match an item or existing texture file resource location, or falls back to air blocks), "parentResearch":string (using the parent research's id), "requirements":array-of-objects, and "effects":array-of-objects.
Research without an effect can still cause recipes to be unlocked, since the recipe json side works off research ids.
research-effect-jsons, which require the "id" and "effect": true properties.  Effects can also have optional "subtitle":string and "level":array-of-numbers fields.  Effects without a "level" property are assumed to go from 0.0 to 5.0 when triggered (basically, hut unlocks).
optional research-remove jsons, which must contain "remove":boolean and "id":string tags.  They remove researches, if the research with the matching ID is present.
optional branch jsons, which must contain "branch-id".  These can be used to set with the "base-time":double modifier which is multiplied to the normal time required for a specific research on that branch, and/or to give a different name to the branch in the University Hut interface through the "name":string property (which must be the displayed text or a full translation key).

Review please

commit.message: Merge cleanup

AbstractBlockHut and AbstractBuilding Research Check Improvements

Improves readability, jdoc, and moves the conversion from block to researcheffect identifier into its own API-accessible method.
Merge branch 'version/1.16.3' into version/1.16.3-research-datapack

Renames

Requested name changes from #suggestions for knockbackaoeability to Whirlwind and the +melee damage whirl(d)wind to Savage Strike.
Merge branch 'version/1.16.3' into version/1.16.3-research-datapack

commit.message: Merge branch 'version/1.16.3' into version/1.16.3-research-datapack

Format, Type, Return Type, and Clean Up Work from Code Review

* researchIds, researchEffectIds and branchIds always ResourceLocation.  Research and Effect Subtitles, Descriptions, and Names always TranslationTexts.  ItemCosts for research and Reset Costs for resetting research are all turned into ItemStorage.
* getIcon() is now split into getIconTextureResourceLocation() and getIconItemStack(), which return just the ResourceLocation or ItemStack, respectively.

* Removed IResearchEffect.getDisplay and IResearchEffect.getBoolean.
* Renamed IResearchEffect.getEffectValue to getEffectStrength.
* Replaced IResearchEffect and IResearchRequirement getAttributes with writeToNBT, and created relevant constructors to reassemble from nbt.
* Implemented an extremely simple pair of ForgeRegistry for ResearchEffects and ResearchRequirements.  The ResearchEffectRegistry will expand over time.
* Changed `EffectManager.clear` to `EffectManager.removeAllEffects`, and significantly expanded the jdoc to explain its current and expected use cases.
* ResearchManagers have an internal field storing the IColony.
* Removal of noop edits or extraneous line breaks.
Merge remote-tracking branch 'gattsuru/version/1.16.3-research-datapack' into version/1.16.3-research-datapack

Turn off Icons, Access

Actually disable DRAW_ICONS, and clean up access modifiers and some related jdocs.
Merge branch 'version/1.16.3' into version/1.16.3-research-datapack

Revert InventoryUtils, Begin DataGenerator Work

Reverts all changes to InventoryUtils to match the ldtteam/version1.16.3 current version.
Moves to predicate-based test approaches for ResearchCosts and ResearchReset costs.
Blatantly copies the CustomRecipe nbt parser.
Partial commit for the research DataGenerator.  Abstract Class and its children are together, but need to fill out the actual implementation listing the current researches and effects.
Some misc cleanup.

Prototype-Level Research Data Generator

Initial version completes, runs, and outputs branch, effect, research files, along with a single lang file.
Merge remote-tracking branch 'ldtteam/version/1.16.3' into version/1.16.3-research-datapack

Updates Research GUI for New BlockOut Compatibility

Moves for compatibility with Text over Label, with the new TooltipBuilder, and for general better compliance. 

Doesn't have the TooltipBuilder formatting arguments right, yet.  Effectively a transfer commit, but wanted to get the merge in place.

Some TooltipBuilder Cleanup

Gets rid of unnecessary resetStyles, readds the deepCopy to styled Research Names to avoid gilding the wrong spots.
Merge branch 'version/1.16.3' into version/1.16.3-research-datapack
Merge branch 'version/1.16.3' into version/1.16.3-research-datapack

Further BlockOut Tooltip Compat

Fixes to use the .style and .color commands properly, instead of styling the translationText before applying it.

JDoc Cleanup, some fixes to match new BlockOut PR

Fixes a number of edge cases regarding tooltips, especially related to the undo/cancel research functions.  Cleans up a number of jdocs and comments, tightens down some access modifiers. 
Hopefully actually removes EntityAIWorkPlanter's erroneously added line this time.

commit.message:
Update src/main/resources/assets/minecolonies/lang/en_us.json

Co-authored-by: ravenbuilder934 <sabrinajamie@outlook.com>

Final Compat Layer Pass, Grammar Fix

Fixes the datagen side of the fix Raven caught, and adds upgrade compat for the Ambition and PlateArmor researches.

nodes.bodyText:
We should consider storing the ResourceLocation on each research. This loading code is great for adding researches, but but we need a way to remove researches too, and the best match for that is going to the resource location.
Please add a mechanism for removing researches.
We're doing something similar for recipes in the RecipeManager. We should use a common approach for this problem.
Can we also add a description here? the autogenerated descriptions aren't great, and aren't localizable.

nodes.bodyText: So, if we know the building here, why do we have all the buildings/blocks with overrides for validating individual researches? As a modpack/datapack author, I may not want to have researches in place for particular buildings, I may be gating on a questbook.

nodes.bodyText: do we still need this override? or can we centralize this?

Ok, this change doesn't make any sense. You're potentially setting the required effect multiple times, with the last one winning. I'd rather see us pick the first unlockability effect, or correctly recognize all of them.
This looks off. The check is against excluded, but changing required?
This also looks off

I love this possibility. I believe that to do this right though, we need to notify that a new research has been discovered, which means checking for these being unlocked onColonyTick somewhere. I'd suggest not on the university itself, but on the TownHall, so that it could be extended to auto-start researches marked appropriately there, and enable scenarios like blocking the university itself until some other criteria is met (School built?)
do we need the Boolean wrapper?

nodes.bodyText: javadoc in this class/above

before we had the two different "effects" which were unlock yes/No or unlock with value. Now we can combine them as int as you kinda did here which makes me wonder if we actually need different "effects". As the way I see it its just a rich information return of the research, and not the actual effect of the research. In that case we wouldnt need effect lists at all/neither any of the current "effect" implementation

nodes.bodyText: Probably good to remove this extra line here
That's not the annotation we're using, we're using the Intellij ones
let's make those doubles and not floats, floats should be reserved to rendering logic

      */

+     * Get the research effect strength which is assigned to a particular string
+     * or zero, if no matching effect is present.

nodes.bodyText: we can remove those, np

Not 100% happy with all this. It's probably better to first loop over all and do a count of the inventory and if the count is fine we loop and remove. For both we have utils already. I know it's a bit less efficient but this is "on button press" logic that is executed not so often, so it should be fine
no return type
What, how were those two not here?

nodes.bodyText: weird
formatting
return empty list here already?
can also probably cleaned up
Can those also be cleaned up?
We shouldn't use I18n.format, can't we just give it a TranslationTextComponent?
What is this todo for?
I'm not fully sure I grasp the idea behind Auto start research. What are the use cases for it? Don't we need a university for this too?
Why isn't this anymore in the place where the progress is incremented?
I've added a new sound handler thing for success and failure sounds, would make sense to integrate this here
I feel like this code should be in the ResearchManager or even in the ResearchTree
newline
Use the dist executor for this then
This seems overly complex to just get a resource location?
I still don't fully understand what and why it does this.
I don't think I want this to be configurable via the config file so easily. Either people play creative mode and get it instant, or wait 1h for a level 1 research.
I would only allow to reset research without concluded parents. This way players have to reset one by one.
double too
can you run the idea auto formatter on the jsons only?

commit.message: Commit of basic functionality for json-based research data packs, and related changes, as described in #6178.
Move ResearchEffectRegistry to handle multiple effects of the same type, cleanup of error during UnlockBuildingEffect construction.

Further updates for #6178.  Includes much stronger input sanitization for researches and research effects from jsons, switches the ResearchEffectRegistry to contain all versions of an effect, and handles updates of researches with unconventionally spelled ids or generically removed (or disabled) research from past file saves.

Also includes some configuration options to make for easier debugging.
Fixes a missed import, and also some translation key versus block name issues.

Transition from static assignment of Research to a datapack-based system, adds logging.

And, finally, deletes the now-empty ResearchInitializer.java.

Apply suggestions from code review

Corrected spellings and grammar formatting related to research.

Co-authored-by: Alex Graham <30493222+ShadowProtocol@users.noreply.github.com>
Co-authored-by: ravenbuilder934 <sabrinajamie@outlook.com>

Better transition to json-based research datapacks.  Implements recommendations from pull requests to json format.  Moves to translation-focused names and descriptions.  Separates effect data from research files.  Adds additional error-checking and sanitization.  Implements a few helper functions to swap between id-derived translationcontexts and user datapack-implemented "name" tags for users who can't or don't want to use the translation files.

Added additional support for handling NBT differences after a research is removed or its name changed.

Tried to get all the places that need translationtextcomponent wrappers were necessary for the updates.  Emphasis on tried.  Both in the "missing some" sense and the "butchering it".

Removed ResearchEffectRegistry and its interfaces.  Necessary components moved to either ResearchEffectCategory or to GlobalResearchTree.  Cleaned up and separated parsing functionality for improved debugging, added a config setting so it's not spamming people randomly.

Implements relative upgrade values for effects, and uses them for most research UI displays.  These relative values are derived only during world load and only in comparison to lower levels.

Expanded logging for Research and ResearchEffect parsing, and added a config option to prevent the logs from spamming people who aren't using the system.

Reduces BlockHut<building>'s individual implementation-dependent checkResearch traits to use a single method in AbstractBlockHut, as a first step to allow arbitrary locking or unlocking of buildings.  Some related cleanup of static variables.

Begins parsing, but not implementation, of "hidden" and "instant" research.  Begins internal support for level-based unlocks, though still exposed to upgrade implementation as booleans.

Adds some ResourceLocation-based indexing for Researches. Use IGlobalResearchTree.getResearchResourceLocation to access.  No accessors for ResourceLocation->research yet, but it is mapped internally to GlobalResearchTree and readily accessed from inside that.

Updates Building<Type> to use the same AbstractBuilding focus as BlockHut<Type> use the same AbstractBlockHut.

Changes the Boolean effect checker in IResearchEffectManager to hasUnlockAbilityEffect and hasUnlockBuildingEffect for better clarity and to handle edge cases where someone tries to lock a recipe behind an id that matches a hutblock name.

Cleans up a wrong jdoc, improves translation text varargs for blockhut unlockable tooltips.
Less buggy fix to the CustomRecipe issue, and some improvements to efficiency on searches for research during that phase.  Also cleans up some no-longer-needed files.
Yet Another Typo Fix

Adds a sorting functionality to branches (by name) and primary research (by resource location), which should give better control over the appearance of the WindowResearchTree graph.  Current settings match pre-transition layout.

Improves and debugs some of the .reset() behavior.

Implements the research "instant" and "hidden" tags, finishes implementation of non-parent Research ResearchRequirements.  "hidden" will make the research (and any child researches) invisible until all building or research requirements are complete.  "instant" will set progress to maximum when run from the University.

Moves MoreScrolls back to slot 2/6 for its branch on WindowResearchTree, as otherwise it's too easy to miss right now.

Some fixes from survival testing, translation and multiplayer.

Implements "autostart" tag, as well as some behaviors to help manage announcements for beginning "autostart" and uncovering of "hidden" research.  Improves sorting for WindowHutUniversity, and implements ability to hide (or at least lock) a full research branch by hiding all members, as well as tooltips to highlight how to unlock that branch.

Moves isResearchRequirementsFulfilled to GlobalResearchTree, as it's likely to be used in more places down the road.

Adds onTick override to Town Hall, currently only used to validate autostart research status.

Removes the various <Type>ResearchEffects in favor of a single GlobalResearchEffect based around floats.  Switches implementations to use getEffectValue (returns float value) and getEffectBoolean (> 0).

Adds an onColonyTick to ResearchManager, registered to worldTickSlow.  Used to handle autostart research, and to better trigger completed research when no university workers are available.  Removes the previous version from BuildingTownHall.

Converts multiple Booleans to booleans.

Changes Research Effect Translation Text Component formatting: $1 is displayEffect, $2 is absoluteEffect, $3 is displayEffect in percent, $4 is absoluteEffect as a percent.  Implements Name as a tag for effects jsons.

Removes effectType as a tag for Research Effects.

Changes EntityAIWorkTeacher to benefit from PrimarySkill before completion of MoreBooks research.  Changes Research Effect overrides to calculate based on absolute values (so -0.05 won't prevent -0.1 from applying) when applying effects to citizens, since healingsaturation at least was using negative values as strengths and it's a useful capability moving forward.  Changes HealingSaturationAddition application logic, since it was previously subtracting a negative and thus prevented 2x 'full' regeneration entirely after its unlocks.

Lots of javadocs, lots of final'd variables.  Removes some unused imports.

Gets rid of a redundant "requires" for locked research branches.

Fixes max colonist number to obey MaxCitizenPerColony setting in light of possible research expansions (or at least the lesser of CITIZEN_CAP research + 25 or 475, instead of previous 175).

Apply suggestions from code review

Corrections to en_us language file, from ravenbuilder934.

Co-authored-by: ravenbuilder934 <sabrinajamie@outlook.com>

Significant refactor of Research Tree displays, focusing around movement to tooltips and icons from labels, along with improved details on university level requirements.  Divides up a big method in WindowResearchTree.  Improves compatibility with https://github.com/ldtteam/Structurize/pull/239.

Adds Research "icon" tags, and support for icons based on items or resourcelocation-based textures.  Assigns temporary icons for all existing research.  Implements world-load-time validation of icon to reduce risk of exceptions being thrown in GUI thread w/ misformed jsons or resource pack/data pack mismatch.  Needs to be divided into client / server at some point.  Some awful programmer art placeholders for some icons as proof of concepts.

Adds and implements "alternate-building" research requirements tags.  These can coexist with normal building requirements, but only one of all "alternate-building"s for a given research will be needed.

Adds ability to cancel research in progress, which sets the research into the ResearchState.CANCELED value.  This research can then be restarted without repaying the cost.  Some work toward doing the same to undo completed T6 or onlyChild research, though this is incomplete and disabled.

Some code de-deplucation for ResearchRequirement.isFulfilled, and cleanup of a related error.  Fixes costs for Deep Pockets/Loaded/Heavily Loaded.  Fixes translation of building hut requirements to names.

Apply suggestions from code review

Commit of grammar- and spelling-related recommendations from code review.

Co-authored-by: ravenbuilder934 <sabrinajamie@outlook.com>

Implements no-reset Research tag, representing research that can not be reset.  This does not yet prevent ancestors from being reset, and the warning texture is just a redstone torch.  Does add a tooltip.

Reverts ResearchState.Canceled change.  Canceled research is removed from the local research tree, and restarting it will incur full costs.  Adds better handling for inconsistent client/server status.  Fixes a case where the client's colony.LocalResearchTree lists could grow unreasonably large.

Adds reset research capabilities for completed T6 research.  Adds a cost to resetting research, consumed when the reset occurs.  Adds a config option to set that cost, and helper functions to validate it.

Adds additional verification steps for research starts, to make sure players actually have all the items the server expects them to need, in case of mismatch.  May need to evaluate doing the same for other checks like onlyChild or parentResearched.

Further UI work in WindowResearchTree.  Tried to move longer translation outputs into multiple lines of text.  Removes early attempts at embedding splits into language file.

Adds missing javadocs/finals.

Fixing a few last cases where the research gui would have wrong data is a player beats the colony update pack to the draw.

Actually includes the no-reset setting for Heavily Loaded.

Properly implements data serialization and deserialization for GlobalResearchTree, only sent when first connecting to a physical server, or when datapacks on a physical server are reloaded.  Apologies ahead of time for what I did to GlobalResearchFactory.

Adds the "branch-id" and "base-time" tags, which can be used to set the (highly estimated!) expected time for a given research branch.  These files can also contain "name" tags which apply to the branch label text as translation text.  Removes the configuration setting to change research speed.

Adds the "subtitle" tag to Researches and Research Effects.  This does need to be a fully-qualified translation key or the string intended to present to users, rather than auto-generated from id, since it's an optional tag.  Only a few items contain it for now.

Removes research-related colony ticking.  Add colony research building requirement checking events to AbstractEntityAIStructureWithWorkOrder's executeSpecificCompleteActions and moved the logic to handle such into ResearchManager. Moves as much of the logic as is practical from TryResearchMessage to LocalResearchTree.

Adds sound effects to some research events and failures.

Switches ItemUtils.tryRemoveStackFromItemHandler and tryRemoveStorageFromItemHandler to check for item presence then remove, rather than previous spool/unspool-on-fail.

Lots of code cleanup: switches to doubles whenever floats were used, gets rid of unused imports, properly wildcards generics when correct, moves some Lists to HashSets, removes duplicates from building registry and adjusts properties to match.  Hopefully managed to keep newlines in line.  Fixes a lot of bad json formatting.
Slightly more elegant approach for NBT-based serialization and deserialization, reduces situations where cost or effect lists seem to get shuffled around.

Improves logic, comments, and clarity of WindowResearchTree.java.  Removes uses of a hard-coded 6, and reduces the usages of MAX_DEPTH when possible to use building.getMaxBuildingLevel instead.  There are still a handful of usages, but changing them involves either cracking open protection levels on UniversityBuilding or using a different hard-coded variable.

Reduces extraneous looping in drawTreeBackground, gets rid of Math.min calls in drawTree (and does some cleanup related to them).

Fixes some behavior related to the armordurabilitymultiplier and tooldurabilitymultiplier effects, as discussed with SomeAddons in the "getting-started" discord.  Clarifies translation text for them.  This is effectively a small nerf to Diamond Coated's line, and a significant buff to Diamond Skin's line.

Apply suggestions from code review

Spelling, grammar, and correctness.

Co-authored-by: ravenbuilder934 <sabrinajamie@outlook.com>

Implements sorting for researches with siblings, based on resource location.  Applies some style recommendations.  Adds a few subtitles.  Improves hovertext color for locked hutblocks.

Removes old tooltip from multiple-reset functionality.  Improves comments further.  Removes situation where multiple valid researches would have the same ResourceLocation.

Capitalization fixes.

Fixing capitalization and styles.

Co-authored-by: ravenbuilder934 <sabrinajamie@outlook.com>

Serializing Research ResourceLocations

Adds ResourceLocation.getPath to the serialization/deserialization process in GlobalResearchFactory.  Only impacts sorting of tree branches now, but may be relevant for other mods using the API side.
Changes requiredUniversityLevel json tag to researchLevel

Apply subtitles from code review

Adding subtitles to additional research tooltips.

Co-authored-by: ravenbuilder934 <sabrinajamie@outlook.com>

Update a constant field name

Missed this in last commit.

Updates another constant field name

Because I missed a file in staging.

Functional commit to match ShadowProtocol's layout and style for WindowResearchTree.  Adds a display of in progress and max in-progress research to WindowHutUniversity.

Adds a number of suggested subtitles.

Removes a few debug-related behaviors, improves Creative research behavior.

Implements ResearchTreeView changes, removes "id" properties.

Adds textures and improved ResearchTreeView gui from ShadowProtocol.
Removes research and researcheffect "id" properties from json, and implements a new id based on resourcelocation. Removes the separate resourceLocation variable.
Implements an improved compatlayer to load old format researches.
Implements a "sortOrder" property for researches.
Changes string separator on ResearchRequirement and ResearchEffect attributes from ':' to '`'.
Adds a few subtitles from ShadowProtocol.
Adds warehouses to the type of hutblocks that will have a tooltip show up if they're locked by research.
Sets research declaring an effect without a corresponding research effect file to act as a simple unlock.  This does mean that researches/effects/*unlock.json and researches/effects/blockhut*.json files are no longer necessary: I've left them included to act as templates for staged levels of unlocks later.

Rebase Cleanup

Cleanup of a rebase to HEAD.

afterCommit.message:
Rebase Cleanup

Cleanup of a rebase to HEAD.

commit.message: Merge branch 'version/1.16.3' into version/1.16.3-research-datapack
